briefTitle: Efficacy and Safety Study of Botulinum Toxin Type A Against Placebo to Treat Spasticity in the Arm After a Stroke
officialTitle: Prospective, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Randomized, Multi-center Study With an Open-label Extension Period to Investigate the Efficacy and Safety of NT 201 in the Treatment of Post-stroke Spasticity of the Upper Limb
conditions: Post-stroke Spasticity of the Upper Limb
summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether injections of Botulinum toxin type A into muscles of the upper limb are effective in treating spasticity in patients after stroke.

primaryOutcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Ashworth Scale (AS) Score of Primary Target Clinical Pattern
